ChunkText: 3. academic difficulty rcl duration: one semester limitations: available to use for one semester only during a degree program cannot be used more than once!
ContextBefore: there is a one-year limit for a student to use a medical rcl throughout the entire degree program, so students with very serious conditions that are highly disruptive to their studies for a term beyond one year should consider relocating outside the US for their care, or applying to change their immigration status to b-2 status, which allows visitors to remain in the US specifically for medical treatment.
ContextAfter: enrollment requirements: must enroll in half of full-time enrollment at least 5 credits for graduate students, at least 6 credits for undergraduate students requirements to be approved: email or letter from course instructor or academic advisor, recommending that the student be allowed to drop the class for one of the following reasons: improper course placement this option is appropriate for students who were advised inappropriately and have taken classes out of sequence, or who were inappropriately allowed to take a course for which they did not have the prerequisite knowledge to be successful.
